intro: Coccoloba escuintlensis, commonly known as the Escuintla coccoloba, is a species of shrub native to Central America. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants known for their distinctive leaf structures and often edible fruits. The plant is characterized by its palmate leaves, which are typically lobed and have a vibrant green color. It thrives in moist, tropical environments and is often found in lowland forests. Its botanical features make it an important component of the local flora and ecosystem.
